results.title: Take me to your Lager
results.brief_description: On landing in outback Australia, an extra-terrestrial stumbles into a local pub to quench his thirst and finds himself getting more than a taste of Australian culture.

results.title: Cog
results.brief_description: A 2D digitally composited animation, with a distinctive 3D look. The mechanical, metalloid, surreal environment, as well as the characters, were created from real life cut-outs (from photographs) of everyday objects. COG is a parable about the beauty of life being ground down by an industrial society.

results.title: iSee
results.brief_description:
Formed in 1998, the Institute for Applied Autonomy (IAA) is an anonymous collective of engineers, designers, artists and activists. With their politically urgent slogan of “now more than ever”, the IAA attempts to re-configure surveillance culture by turning technologies of surveillance back on the very authorities that control them. IAA projects play a dual role: on the one hand, they are pedagogical devices that prompt public discussion of the critical issues surrounding surveillance, power and urban space; on the other hand, they are functional tools that have a real-world application within urban environments.

The iSee project is a web-based application that charts the location of closed-circuit television (CCTV) cameras in Manhattan. Adapted from actual, surveillance data, iSee generates the paths through Manhattan (and soon London) that fall under the least surveillance. In exposing the presence of electronic surveillance systems, iSee allows the public to choose when and how they are recorded

results.title: City of spare parts
results.brief_description: New and unfamiliar environments, such as cities are experienced in fragments, pieces and parts. Based on the concept of momentary interactions, the format is cyclic.The interface design is modeled from the idea of a mud map.

results.title: Small treasures
results.brief_description: Based on autobiographical experience, Small Treasures is about the still birth of a child. Written in a diary form, it follows an ordinary pregnancy through to its devastating conclusion. Beautifully made and hand coloured this film won best short at the Venice Film Festival.
results.description: Based on autobiographical experience, Small Treasures is about the still birth of a child. Written in a diary form, it follows an ordinary pregnancy through to its devastating conclusion. Beautifully made and hand coloured this film won best short at the Venice Film Festival.

results.title: Seabound
results.brief_description: Seabound is an exquisitely animated journey into a forgotten, grinding ocean, where a weeping boat carries a haunting past. Donna Kendrigan’s imaginative puppets are intriguing characters, whose beauty is complimented by the film’s delicately constructed sets.
results.description: Seabound is an exquisitely animated journey into a forgotten, grinding ocean, where a weeping boat carries a haunting past. Donna Kendrigan’s imaginative puppets are intriguing characters, whose beauty is complimented by the film’s delicately constructed sets.

results.title: A Saucer of water for the birds
results.brief_description: The unusual technique of sand animation is used to tell the story of a woman and her granddaughter. It starts with them sitting at the kitchen table playing cards. As the cards are shuffled and cut, the film cuts between pre-war Poland, Europe in the Holocaust, the woman’s childhood and the present. The old woman’s homeland is evoked as a world the child strives to create from anecdotes. The woman’s present is shown as one etched with darkness of her family’s experience of the Holocaust.
